Pūjā parivena：A monastery in Anurādhapura to which the Nāgas followed Sonuttara when he brought the relics from the Nāga world in order to deposit them in the Mahā Thūpa．

From Pūjā-parivena the Nāgas were induced to return by being given a few of the relics．

（Mhv．xxxi．4； MT．575．）．v．l．Punna parivena．
